intro: Tetrorchidium euryphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leaved tetrorchidium, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, broad leaves and intricate floral structures. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with a subtle fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
